11#ifndef RTC_BASE_OPENSSL_STREAM_ADAPTER_H_
12#define RTC_BASE_OPENSSL_STREAM_ADAPTER_H_
13
14#include <openssl/ossl_typ.h>
15#include <stddef.h>
16#include <stdint.h>
17
18#include <memory>
19#include <string>
20#include <vector>
21
22#include "absl/types/optional.h"
23#include "rtc_base/buffer.h"
24#ifdef OPENSSL_IS_BORINGSSL
25#include "rtc_base/boringssl_identity.h"
26#else
27#include "rtc_base/openssl_identity.h"
28#endif
29#include "rtc_base/ssl_identity.h"
30#include "rtc_base/ssl_stream_adapter.h"
31#include "rtc_base/stream.h"
32#include "rtc_base/system/rtc_export.h"
33#include "rtc_base/task_utils/pending_task_safety_flag.h"
34#include "rtc_base/task_utils/repeating_task.h"
35
36namespace rtc {
37
38// This class was written with OpenSSLAdapter (a socket adapter) as a
39// starting point. It has similar structure and functionality, but uses a
40// "peer-to-peer" mode, verifying the peer's certificate using a digest
41// sent over a secure signaling channel.
42//
43// Static methods to initialize and deinit the SSL library are in
44// OpenSSLAdapter. These should probably be moved out to a neutral class.
45//
46// In a few cases I have factored out some OpenSSLAdapter code into static
47// methods so it can be reused from this class. Eventually that code should
48// probably be moved to a common support class. Unfortunately there remain a
49// few duplicated sections of code. I have not done more restructuring because
50// I did not want to affect existing code that uses OpenSSLAdapter.
51//
52// This class does not support the SSL connection restart feature present in
53// OpenSSLAdapter. I am not entirely sure how the feature is useful and I am
54// not convinced that it works properly.
55//
56// This implementation is careful to disallow data exchange after an SSL error,
57// and it has an explicit SSL_CLOSED state. It should not be possible to send
58// any data in clear after one of the StartSSL methods has been called.
59
60// Look in sslstreamadapter.h for documentation of the methods.
61
62class SSLCertChain;
63
64///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
65
66// If |allow| has a value, its value determines if legacy TLS protocols are
67// allowed, overriding the default configuration.
68// If |allow| has no value, any previous override is removed and the default
69// configuration is restored.
70RTC_EXPORT void SetAllowLegacyTLSProtocols(const absl::optional<bool>& allow);
71
72class OpenSSLStreamAdapter final : public SSLStreamAdapter {
73 public:
74 explicit OpenSSLStreamAdapter(std::unique_ptr<StreamInterface> stream);
75 ~OpenSSLStreamAdapter() override;
76
77 void SetIdentity(std::unique_ptr<SSLIdentity> identity) override;
78 SSLIdentity* GetIdentityForTesting() const override;
79
80 // Default argument is for compatibility
81 void SetServerRole(SSLRole role = SSL_SERVER) override;
82 bool SetPeerCertificateDigest(
83 const std::string& digest_alg,
84 const unsigned char* digest_val,
85 size_t digest_len,
86 SSLPeerCertificateDigestError* error = nullptr) override;
87
88 std::unique_ptr<SSLCertChain> GetPeerSSLCertChain() const override;
89
90 // Goes from state SSL_NONE to either SSL_CONNECTING or SSL_WAIT, depending
91 // on whether the underlying stream is already open or not.
92 int StartSSL() override;
93 void SetMode(SSLMode mode) override;
94 void SetMaxProtocolVersion(SSLProtocolVersion version) override;
95 void SetInitialRetransmissionTimeout(int timeout_ms) override;
96
97 StreamResult Read(void* data,
98 size_t data_len,
99 size_t* read,
100 int* error) override;
101 StreamResult Write(const void* data,
102 size_t data_len,
103 size_t* written,
104 int* error) override;
105 void Close() override;
106 StreamState GetState() const override;
107
108 // TODO(guoweis): Move this away from a static class method.
109 static std::string SslCipherSuiteToName(int crypto_suite);
110
111 bool GetSslCipherSuite(int* cipher) override;
112
113 SSLProtocolVersion GetSslVersion() const override;
114 bool GetSslVersionBytes(int* version) const override;
115 // Key Extractor interface
116 bool ExportKeyingMaterial(const std::string& label,
117 const uint8_t* context,
118 size_t context_len,
119 bool use_context,
120 uint8_t* result,
121 size_t result_len) override;
122
123 // DTLS-SRTP interface
124 bool SetDtlsSrtpCryptoSuites(const std::vector<int>& crypto_suites) override;
125 bool GetDtlsSrtpCryptoSuite(int* crypto_suite) override;
126
127 bool IsTlsConnected() override;
128
129 // Capabilities interfaces.
130 static bool IsBoringSsl();
131
132 static bool IsAcceptableCipher(int cipher, KeyType key_type);
133 static bool IsAcceptableCipher(const std::string& cipher, KeyType key_type);
134
135 // Use our timeutils.h source of timing in BoringSSL, allowing us to test
136 // using a fake clock.
137 static void EnableTimeCallbackForTesting();
138
139 private:
140 enum SSLState {
141 // Before calling one of the StartSSL methods, data flows
142 // in clear text.
143 SSL_NONE,
144 SSL_WAIT, // waiting for the stream to open to start SSL negotiation
145 SSL_CONNECTING, // SSL negotiation in progress
146 SSL_CONNECTED, // SSL stream successfully established
147 SSL_ERROR, // some SSL error occurred, stream is closed
148 SSL_CLOSED // Clean close
149 };
150
151 void OnEvent(StreamInterface* stream, int events, int err);
152
153 void PostEvent(int events, int err);
154 void SetTimeout(int delay_ms);
155
156 // The following three methods return 0 on success and a negative
157 // error code on failure. The error code may be from OpenSSL or -1
158 // on some other error cases, so it can't really be interpreted
159 // unfortunately.
160
161 // Prepare SSL library, state is SSL_CONNECTING.
162 int BeginSSL();
163 // Perform SSL negotiation steps.
164 int ContinueSSL();
165
166 // Error handler helper. signal is given as true for errors in
167 // asynchronous contexts (when an error method was not returned
168 // through some other method), and in that case an SE_CLOSE event is
169 // raised on the stream with the specified error.
170 // A 0 error means a graceful close, otherwise there is not really enough
171 // context to interpret the error code.
172 // |alert| indicates an alert description (one of the SSL_AD constants) to
173 // send to the remote endpoint when closing the association. If 0, a normal
174 // shutdown will be performed.
175 void Error(const char* context, int err, uint8_t alert, bool signal);
176 void Cleanup(uint8_t alert);
177
178 // Flush the input buffers by reading left bytes (for DTLS)
179 void FlushInput(unsigned int left);
180
181 // SSL library configuration
182 SSL_CTX* SetupSSLContext();
183 // Verify the peer certificate matches the signaled digest.
184 bool VerifyPeerCertificate();
185
186#ifdef OPENSSL_IS_BORINGSSL
187 // SSL certificate verification callback. See SSL_CTX_set_custom_verify.
188 static enum ssl_verify_result_t SSLVerifyCallback(SSL* ssl,
189 uint8_t* out_alert);
190#else
191 // SSL certificate verification callback. See
192 // SSL_CTX_set_cert_verify_callback.
193 static int SSLVerifyCallback(X509_STORE_CTX* store, void* arg);
194#endif
195
196 bool WaitingToVerifyPeerCertificate() const {
197 return GetClientAuthEnabled() && !peer_certificate_verified_;
198 }
199
200 bool HasPeerCertificateDigest() const {
201 return !peer_certificate_digest_algorithm_.empty() &&
202 !peer_certificate_digest_value_.empty();
203 }
204
205 const std::unique_ptr<StreamInterface> stream_;
206
207 rtc::Thread* const owner_;
208 webrtc::ScopedTaskSafety task_safety_;
209 webrtc::RepeatingTaskHandle timeout_task_;
210
211 SSLState state_;
212 SSLRole role_;
213 int ssl_error_code_; // valid when state_ == SSL_ERROR or SSL_CLOSED
214 // Whether the SSL negotiation is blocked on needing to read or
215 // write to the wrapped stream.
216 bool ssl_read_needs_write_;
217 bool ssl_write_needs_read_;
218
219 SSL* ssl_;
220 SSL_CTX* ssl_ctx_;
221
222 // Our key and certificate.
223#ifdef OPENSSL_IS_BORINGSSL
224 std::unique_ptr<BoringSSLIdentity> identity_;
225#else
226 std::unique_ptr<OpenSSLIdentity> identity_;
227#endif
228 // The certificate chain that the peer presented. Initially null, until the
229 // connection is established.
230 std::unique_ptr<SSLCertChain> peer_cert_chain_;
231 bool peer_certificate_verified_ = false;
232 // The digest of the certificate that the peer must present.
233 Buffer peer_certificate_digest_value_;
234 std::string peer_certificate_digest_algorithm_;
235
236 // The DtlsSrtp ciphers
237 std::string srtp_ciphers_;
238
239 // Do DTLS or not
240 SSLMode ssl_mode_;
241
242 // Max. allowed protocol version
243 SSLProtocolVersion ssl_max_version_;
244
245 // A 50-ms initial timeout ensures rapid setup on fast connections, but may
246 // be too aggressive for low bandwidth links.
247 int dtls_handshake_timeout_ms_ = 50;
248
249 // TODO(https://bugs.webrtc.org/10261): Completely remove this option in M84.
250 const bool support_legacy_tls_protocols_flag_;
251};
252
253/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
254
255} // namespace rtc
256
257#endif // RTC_BASE_OPENSSL_STREAM_ADAPTER_H_
258
